comments.body: Please also add a test for string constructor.

Ideally, the test should cover all cases for both `input` and `replaceInput`.
So please copy-paste instead of overwriting (I cannot beleive that I just asked someone to copy-paste code ðŸ˜„)

Also, it seems that neither of them have a test for the case without a type argument, e.g. 

```typescript
requestStoredProcedureWithOutput.input("name", "abc");
requestStoredProcedureWithOutput.replaceInput("name", "abc");
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +119,123 @@        requestStoredProcedureWithOutput.replaceInput("name", sql.Decimal, 155.33);              // decimal(18, 0)
        requestStoredProcedureWithOutput.replaceInput("name", sql.Decimal(10), 155.33);          // decimal(10, 0)
        requestStoredProcedureWithOutput.replaceInput("name", sql.Decimal(10, 2), 155.33);       // decimal(10, 2)

        requestStoredProcedureWithOutput.replaceInput("name", sql.DateTime2, new Date());        // datetime2(7)
